Member Function Documentation

virtual void Net::Service::call ( CallStack::Message &  msg,
CallStack *  cc 
) [virtual]

Entry point for a service. Derived user service should may this method. This method is the main entry point to call a service. Current default implementation invokes the deprecated entry point for compatibility reason.

A network implantation calls this method if message arrives. The call should neither be q blocking call, neither post message to network, else deadlock may appears depending on the concret network implantation. Please read the feature list about such a specific implantation.

This method is called for the AM, WS, and AWS protocols when all data of the message have been received (both immediate and defered data). The CallStack have public fields that should be used to unpack or get data, or to access to the status of the message. All exception throws by the call to this method are catched to report a service call error into all network implantation.

Parameters:
cc (IN) the call context
See also:
CallStack
virtual void Net::Service::call ( CallStack *  cc  )  [virtual]

Entry point for a service. Derived user service may implement this method.

This method is deprecated.

A network implantation calls this method if message arrives. The call should neither be q blocking call, neither post message to network, else deadlock may appears depending on the concret network implantation. Please read the feature list about such a specific implantation.

This method is called for the AM, WS, and AWS protocols when all data of the message have been received (both immediate and defered data). The CallStack have public fields that should be used to unpack or get data, or to access to the status of the message. All exception throws by the call to this method are catched to report a service call error into all network implementation.

Parameters:
cc (IN) the call context
See also:
CallStack

Reimplemented in WS::ServiceLeaderAM, WS::ServiceSignal, WS::ServiceSteal, MANET::Device::ConnectionRequest, MANET::Device::IncomingConnection, NetData::ServiceGlobalPointer, NetData::ServiceGlobalVariable, NetData::ServiceMonotonicBound, NetData::ServiceSingleAssignment, NetData::ServiceBlock, Ctrl::KillService, Stat::StatisticsService, Stat::ServiceReceiveStat, Net::ServiceGroup, Net::BastOutChannel, Net::RPCService, Net::ServiceError, Net::ServicePing, Net::ServicePong, Net::ServiceVoid, Net::ServiceClose, SOCKNET::ServiceClose, Sched::ServiceBcast, Sched::ServiceRedistribution, Sched::ServiceMigrate, FT::CCKCheckpointCoordinator, FT::CCKLocalCheckpointController, FT::CCKGlobalRestartCoordinator, FT::CCKGlobalRestartLocalController, FT::CCKRestartCoordinator, FT::CCKRestartLocalController, FT::StoreCheckpointService, FT::LoadCheckpointService, FT::HeartBeatDetector, FT::SignalCommit, and FT::TICRestart.

virtual IOVectEntry* Net::Service::get_iovector ( CallStack *  cc,
size_t &  size_iovector 
) [virtual]

Entry point to decode address from incomming message in order to store DA kind data. This entry point is called in case of using the Write&Signal communication protocol. On input, only the IA data are present and could be unpacked from the callstack. On return the method should provide the pointer to the IOVectEntry as well as the size of the vector. On return the communication runtime will place directly the data to the address pointed by the iovector and it will call the method 'call'. Default implementation do nothing.

static void Net::Service::redirect ( OutChannel *  channel,
CallStack *  cc 
) [static]

Redirection of message This method redirect all remainder data (IA and DA) of the active message to the channel
